text: Atorvastatin (brand name Lipitor) is a statin drug. It is used for preventing cardiovascular disease and treating abnormal lipid levels (to lower cholesterol). In addition heart disease, it is also given to prevent strokes. It may also be prescribed for people with a family history of heart disease, or a long-term health condition such as type 1 or type 2 diabetes or rheumatoid arthritis. The medication is available as a generic drug. In 2021, it was the most commonly prescribed medication in the United States, with more than 116 million prescriptions filled for over 28 million patients. Atorvastatin was first synthesized in 1985 by Dr. Bruce Roth and approved by the FDA in 1996. Patented by Pfizer. It is on the World Health Organization's List of Essential Medicines. == Related pages== * Statin: Rosuvastatin * Cardiovascular system ==References== Category:Statins Category:Organonitrogen compounds Category:Organofluorides
